title: How to Cut a Hole in an Object in Adobe Illustrator

steps.title: Open Adobe Illustrator.
steps.content: Open Adobe Illustrator. Any version will do. Wait until the program opens.

steps.title: Create a new document.
steps.content: Create a new document. Simply press Ctrl + N. A window will pop out saying "New Document." Just enter your desired size then click Okay.

steps.title: Grab the Ellipse tool from the toolbar of the new document.
steps.content: Grab the Ellipse tool from the toolbar of the new document. It is located on the left side of the screen.

steps.title: Drag and hold the Shift button to create a perfect circle.
steps.content: Drag and hold the Shift button to create a perfect circle.

steps.title: Grab the Ellipse tool again or press L.
steps.content: Grab the Ellipse tool again or press L.

steps.title: Drag and hold the Shift button inside the circle that you created a while ago.
steps.content: Drag and hold the Shift button inside the circle that you created a while ago. This will be the hole of the object.

steps.title: Turn your object into an outline by pressing Ctrl + Y.
steps.content: Turn your object into an outline by pressing Ctrl + Y. This will make the sides of the objects visible. Move the circle inside the object to where you want to cut a hole. Clicking the Ctrl + Y again will bring back the color of the shapes.

steps.title: Go to Pathfinder.
steps.content: Go to Pathfinder. If you cannot see it on the right side of the screen, so just go to Window on the menu bar. Check the Pathfinder and it will appear.

steps.title: Click "Exclude" on the Shape Mode of the Pathfinder.
steps.content: Click "Exclude" on the Shape Mode of the Pathfinder. Make sure that both objects are selected. To select them, press Ctrl + A. The hole has now been cut. You will notice that two objects become one after selecting "Exclude."
